trans-unit.source: Defines an activity-qualified location that corresponds to a user event in the potential execution path of a root workflow instance.
This class cannot be inherited.

> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] An activity designer or a workflow designer may use any of the overloaded <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.TrackData%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext.TrackData%2A?displayProperty=fullName> methods to instrument the workflow to emit data to the runtime tracking infrastructure as a user event.
The data emitted is referred to as user data.
Unlike activity status events, and workflow status events, which occur only on activity or workflow status changes, user events can occur at any location that is instrumented in a workflow.

A UserTrackingLocation defines the matching parameters for such a location by specifying the type of the user data, the type of the activity from which it must be emitted, a collection of conditions that can more precisely qualify an instance or instances of this activity, an optional key name with which the user data must be associated, whether derived types of the user data should be matched, and whether user data emitted from activities derived from the type of the specified activity should be matched.
> [!NOTE] > A single UserTrackingLocation may refer to more than one actual location in the potential execution path of a workflow instance.

You may add a UserTrackingLocation to either <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackPoint.MatchingLocations%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackPoint.ExcludedLocations%2A?displayProperty=fullName> in order to define the match parameters for a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackPoint> in a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingProfile>.

There are three general conditions which must be met in the following order for the UserTrackingLocation to be matched by the runtime tracking infrastructure: the activity that has emitted a user event must match the set of activities specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ActivityType%2A>, <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ActivityTypeName%2A>, <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.Conditions%2A>, and <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.MatchDerivedActivityTypes%2A>; the key, if one exists, associated with the user data must match <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.KeyName%2A>; and, the type of the user data emitted by the user event must match the set of user data types specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ArgumentType%2A>, <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ArgumentTypeName%2A>, and <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.MatchDerivedArgumentTypes%2A>.
Only if all three of these conditions are met, does the runtime tracking infrastructure consider the UserTrackingLocation matched.

To configure a UserTrackingLocation, you must set either <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ArgumentTypeName%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ArgumentType%2A> to specify the type of the user data to be matched and either <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ActivityTypeName%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ActivityType%2A> to specify the type of the activity from which the user data must be emitted to be matched.

You may add <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingCondition> objects to <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.Conditions%2A> to more completely qualify the activity from which the user data must be emitted.

You may set <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.MatchDerivedArgumentTypes%2A> to specify that user data derived from the user data type specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ArgumentTypeName%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ArgumentType%2A> should be matched, and you may set <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.MatchDerivedActivityTypes%2A> to specify that user data emitted from activities derived from the activity type specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ActivityTypeName%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ActivityType%2A> should be matched.

You may set <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.KeyName%2A> to specify that only user data associated with the specified key name should be matched for this UserTrackingLocation.

If <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.KeyName%2A> is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic), the runtime tracking structure will not try to match the key associated with the user data.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation"></xref> class.
The default constructor initializes an empty <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation>.
You must specify both the type of the user data to match and the type of the activity from which it must be emitted in order to be matched.

Therefore, to configure the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation> you must explicitly set either <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ActivityTypeName%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ActivityType%2A> to specify the type of an activity from which user data must be emitted to be matched, and you must also explicitly set either <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ArgumentTypeName%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ArgumentType%2A> to specify the type of the user data to be matched.
You may further configure the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation> by setting its other properties.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation"></xref> class by using the unqualified name of the common language runtime (CLR) type of the user data.
This constructor initializes a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation> that matches user data of the specified type emitted from the workflow.
You must specify the unqualified name of the <xref:System.Type> of the user data to be matched for `argumentTypeName`.

You must explicitly set either <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ActivityType%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ActivityTypeName%2A> in your code to properly configure the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation>.
You may further qualify the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation> by setting its other properties.
The unqualified name of the CLR type of the user data to be matched.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation"></xref> class using the common language runtime (CLR) type of the user data.
This constructor initializes a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation> that matches user data of the specified type emitted from the workflow.

You must explicitly set either <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ActivityType%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ActivityTypeName%2A> in your code to properly configure the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation>.
You may further qualify the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation> by setting its other properties.
The <xref:System.Type> of the user data to be matched.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation"></xref> class by using the unqualified name of the common language runtime (CLR) type of the user data and the unqualified name of the CLR type of the activity from which the user data must be emitted.
This constructor initializes a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation> that matches all user data of the specified type emitted from activities of the specified type.
You must specify the unqualified name of the <xref:System.Type> of the activity and of the user data.
For example the unqualified name of the <xref:System.Type> of a <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.CodeActivity> activity is "Code".
You may further qualify the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation> by setting its other properties.
The unqualified name of the CLR type of the user data to be matched.
The unqualified name of the CLR type of the activity from which the user data must be emitted.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation"></xref> class by using the unqualified name of the common language runtime (CLR) type of the user data and the CLR type of the activity from which the user data must be emitted.
This constructor initializes a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation> that matches all user data of the specified type emitted from activities of the specified type.
You must specify the unqualified name of the <xref:System.Type> of the user data.
You may further qualify the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation> by setting its other properties.
The unqualified name of the CLR type of the user data to be matched.
The <xref:System.Type> of the activity from which the user data must be emitted.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation"></xref> class by using the common language runtime (CLR) type of the user data and unqualified name of the CLR type of the activity from which the user data must be emitted.
This constructor initializes a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation> that matches all user data of the specified type emitted from activities of the specified type.
You must specify the unqualified name of the <xref:System.Type> of the activity.
For example the unqualified name of the <xref:System.Type> of a <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.CodeActivity> activity is "Code".
You may further qualify the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation> by setting its other properties.
The <xref:System.Type> of the user data to be matched.
The unqualified name of the CLR type of the activity from which the user data must be emitted.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation"></xref> class by using the common language runtime (CLR) type of the user data and the CLR type of the activity from which the user data must be emitted.
This constructor initializes a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation> that matches all user data of the specified type emitted from activities of the specified type.
You may further qualify the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation> by setting its other properties.
The <xref:System.Type> of the user data to be matched.
The <xref:System.Type> of the activity from which the user data must be emitted.
Gets or sets the common language runtime (CLR) type of the activity from which the user data must be emitted to be tracked.
If you want to specify the type of the activity in a version-independent manner, use <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ActivityTypeName%2A>.

You must specify either ActivityType or <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ActivityTypeName%2A> to properly configure the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation>.
The <xref:System.Type> of the activity from which the data must be emitted.
Gets or sets the unqualified name of the common language runtime (CLR) type of the activity from which the user data must be emitted to be tracked.
You must specify the unqualified name of the type of the activity.
For example, to specify the unqualified name of a <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.CodeActivity> activity, set ActivityTypeName to "Code".
ActivityTypeName provides a much easier way to specify the type of the activity that emits the user data when you author a profile directly in XML.
ActivityTypeName also provides a version-independent way of referring to the type of the activity.

You must specify either ActivityTypeName or <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ActivityType%2A> to properly configure the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation>.
The unqualified name of the <xref:System.Type> of the activity from which the data must be emitted.
Gets or sets the common language runtime (CLR) type of the user data to be tracked.
If you want to specify the type of the user data in a version-independent manner, use <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ArgumentTypeName%2A>.

You must specify either ArgumentType or <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ArgumentTypeName%2A> to properly configure the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation>.
The <xref:System.Type> of the user data to be tracked.
Gets or sets the unqualified name of the common language runtime (CLR) type of the user data to be tracked.
ArgumentTypeName provides a much easier way to specify the type of the user data when you author a profile directly in XML.
ArgumentTypeName also provides a version-independent way of referring to the type of the user data.

You must specify either ArgumentTypeName or <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ArgumentType%2A> to properly configure the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation>.
The unqualified name of the <xref:System.Type> of the user data.
Gets a collection of conditions that are used to qualify the activity from which the user data must be emitted to be tracked.

You can use Conditions to more precisely define the instance of the activity type specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ActivityTypeName%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ActivityType%2A> from which the user event must be emitted to match the tracking location.

For example, if you want to match only <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.CodeActivity> activities with an <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.Name%2A> equal to "MyCode", you can set <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ActivityTypeName%2A> to "Code" and add an <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityTrackingCondition> to Conditions that specifies that the ID property of the activity instance must be equal to "MyCode".
Every <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingCondition> in Conditions must be true for the activity to be matched.
A <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingConditionCollection"></xref> that is used to qualify the activity from which the user data must be emitted.
Get or sets the name with which the user data must be associated for the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation"></xref> to be matched.

An activity designer or a workflow designer can use either <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.TrackData%28System.String%2CSystem.Object%29?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext.TrackData%28System.String%2CSystem.Object%29?displayProperty=fullName> to associate a string key with the user data that is emitted in a user event.

If KeyName is not a null reference (`Nothing`), the key associated with the user data must match the value of KeyName for the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation> to be matched.

If KeyName is a null reference (`Nothing`), the runtime tracking infrastructure does not check for a matching key to determine whether the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation> is matched.

A <xref uid="langword_csharp_string" name="string" href=""></xref> key with which the user data must be associated for the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation"></xref> to be matched or a null reference (<xref uid="langword_csharp_Nothing" name="Nothing" href=""></xref> in Visual Basic).

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the user data should be tracked when it is emitted from activities derived from the activity type specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ActivityType*> or <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ActivityTypeName*>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the user data should be tracked when it is emitted from activities derived from the type specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ActivityType*> or <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ActivityTypeName*>; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The User tracking location is a way to filter user tracked data.

The user can filter by the type of the user tracked data by specifying the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ArgumentType*> or <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ArgumentTypeName*>.

Setting the <xref uid="langword_csharp_MatchDerrivedArgumentTypes" name="MatchDerrivedArgumentTypes" href=""></xref><xref uid="langword_csharp_Boolean" name="Boolean" href=""></xref> value to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> specifies that the user tracked data can be of type ArgumentType/ArgumentTypeName or a type derived from the ArgumentType/ArgumentTypeName.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if user data derived from the type of the user data specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ArgumentType*> or <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingLocation.ArgumentTypeName*> should be tracked; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
